pageContext.claim: “And if we had a barrier of any kind -- a powerful barrier, whether it's steel or concrete -- if we had a barrier, they wouldn't be able to make that turn...So we'd stop human trafficking in this section of the world. I think it would stop it 90, 95 percent. A tremendous percentage would stop.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has no basis to claim that human trafficking across the southern border would drop 95 percent if a wall is built. He appears to conflate human smuggling across the border with trafficking for labor or sex. Human trafficking often occurs not over the border but through ports of entry such as airports.
